main event: A CIRVIS report of a round spinning object was observed near the North Star on 21 September 1961.
interesting points: The object was disc-shaped and had a black object seemingly accompanying it., The observation lasted for 1 hour and 12 minutes., The object was changing colors, red, white, blue, and green., The object was seen stationary about 45 degrees above the horizon and was very bright., It was reported that the object exhibited a distinctive spinning motion.
witness description: CPL Bayley from the Marine Detachment at Navy Radio Station Wahiawa
